title: Britain's Stojsavljevic, 15, denied first WTA win
description: Mika Stojsavljevic, 15, is denied her first ever WTA victory after a narrow defeat by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima.
excerpt: Mika Stojsavljevic, 15, is denied her first ever WTA victory after a narrow defeat by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima.
text: British teenager Mika Stojsavljevic was denied a first WTA win after an agonising 6-4 6-7 (7-9) 7-6 (8-6) defeat by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima in the first round of the Pan Pacific Open. The 15-year-old, the reigning US Open girls' champion, held a 3-2 lead against Uchijima in the first set before she was broken three times in a row to lose the opener. Stojsavljevic, who was playing in her first main-draw match, saved two match points in the second set and went on to win the tie-break 9-7 to level the match.She took that momentum into the deciding set, breaking Uchijima, ranked 57th in the world, to take a 5-2 lead. But the world number 633 missed the opportunity to serve out the match, allowing 23-year-old Uchijima to level at 5-5. In the tie-break, Stojsavljevic saved two more match points but Uchijima recovered to see out the win.Uchijima will face top seed Zheng Qinwen in the second round in Tokyo. Elsewhere, British number one Katie Boulter is through to the last 16 after easing to a 6-1 6-4 win against Australia's Priscilla Hon. The 28-year-old broke the Australian three times in the first set, converting 100% of her break points.It was similarly straightforward for Boulter in the second set as she broke Hon, ranked 184 places below her, twice.The world number 33 will play Japan's Kyoka Okamura next. British men's number one Jack Draper overcame Japan's Kei Nishikori 7-6 (7-5) 7-5 in the first round of the Vienna Open.Former world number four Nishikori broke Draper's serve to establish a 5-3 lead in the opening set, but the Briton hit back immediately and took it to a tie-break.The players could not be separated after the first 10 points but Draper won the next two to claim the set.The second went with serve until Draper broke in the final game to clinch victory and set up a last-16 match against Italian Luciano Darderi, who ended Dominic Thiem's career on Tuesday.Earlier on Tuesday, British number two Cameron Norrie was beaten 6-4 7-6 (7-4) by American fifth seed Frances Tiafoe.Norrie came from a break down in the second set to force a tie-break, but he then lost the first three points and Tiafoe did not look back, setting up an appetising last-16 match against Matteo Berrettini.
html:
British teenager Mika Stojsavljevic was denied a first WTA win after an agonising 6-4 6-7 (7-9) 7-6 (8-6) defeat by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima in the first round of the Pan Pacific Open.

The 15-year-old, the reigning US Open girls' champion, held a 3-2 lead against Uchijima in the first set before she was broken three times in a row to lose the opener.

Stojsavljevic, who was playing in her first main-draw match, saved two match points in the second set and went on to win the tie-break 9-7 to level the match.

She took that momentum into the deciding set, breaking Uchijima, ranked 57th in the world, to take a 5-2 lead.

But the world number 633 missed the opportunity to serve out the match, allowing 23-year-old Uchijima to level at 5-5.

In the tie-break, Stojsavljevic saved two more match points but Uchijima recovered to see out the win.

Uchijima will face top seed Zheng Qinwen in the second round in Tokyo.

Elsewhere, British number one Katie Boulter is through to the last 16 after easing to a 6-1 6-4 win against Australia's Priscilla Hon.

The 28-year-old broke the Australian three times in the first set, converting 100% of her break points.

It was similarly straightforward for Boulter in the second set as she broke Hon, ranked 184 places below her, twice.

The world number 33 will play Japan's Kyoka Okamura next.

British men's number one Jack Draper overcame Japan's Kei Nishikori 7-6 (7-5) 7-5 in the first round of the Vienna Open.

Former world number four Nishikori broke Draper's serve to establish a 5-3 lead in the opening set, but the Briton hit back immediately and took it to a tie-break.

The players could not be separated after the first 10 points but Draper won the next two to claim the set.

The second went with serve until Draper broke in the final game to clinch victory and set up a last-16 match against Italian Luciano Darderi, who ended Dominic Thiem's career on Tuesday.

Earlier on Tuesday, British number two Cameron Norrie was beaten 6-4 7-6 (7-4) by American fifth seed Frances Tiafoe.

Norrie came from a break down in the second set to force a tie-break, but he then lost the first three points and Tiafoe did not look back, setting up an appetising last-16 match against Matteo Berrettini.
